page.title: 03Burford Tourist Information
page.content: Burford Tourist Information Centre in Sheep Street is housed in the Â£Old Brewery' premises where Mr. Bill Kerr gives advice on suitable accommodation to suit the interests of tourists.He gives details of visits available to historic houses, gardens and wildlife parks in the area and timetable information on bus, train and air travel. Local accommodation bookings are arranged for a modest service fee.Queries are dealt with from all over the world and an answerphone service is operated when the office is closed. Burford is popular with visitors all year round and especially in summer. Many people come to see the Church, the Tolsey Museum, ancient inns and fine Cotswold buildings and rolling countryside in the Burford area.
